text: I‚Äôll be on WMTW/ABC News Portland at 5 & 6 pm tonight discussing my call for Democratic debates. Tune in!

Do you think this guy should be able to use facial recognition to keep tabs on his adult daughter?  I don't either. We need to regulate this technology and do it now.  check out my tech reform agenda here: https://medium.com/@rossformaine/my-tech-reform-agenda-d36119afa29a

This is a great piece.  Big Tobacco, Big Oil, Big Tech -- they all use the same corporate playbook: SAY you care about the environment, SAY you care about people, SAY you care about doing the right thing. DO anything to maximize profits. Greed and corruption have infected American corporations -- and Washington. It's time to elect new leaders who aren't afraid to stand up and do the right thing. I've done it my whole life and I'll do it in the US Senate.  More about how I've spent my career here: https://www.newyorker.com/news/q-and-a/a-former-google-executive-calls-for-a-new-emphasis-on-human-rights

I‚Äôm happy to share with you that two of my fellow Democratic candidates for Senate have agreed to the debate challenge we issued yesterday.  Sara Gideon has not. And I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs acceptable. Mainers deserve to see their candidates for U.S. Senate on stage, in public, in their communities, debating the issues that matter.  If you‚Äôre with me, share this message on social media with the hashtag #MainersWantDebates.
Great news! üëçüèª https://twitter.com/newscentermaine/status/1235289962184151040?s=20

As Mainers head to the polls to cast their votes in the presidential primary on Super Tuesday, U.S. Sen. Democratic candidate Ross LaJeunesse is looking ahead to the state primary in June.  There are currently no debates scheduled ahead of the primary. "Voters deserve better," LaJeunesse told NEWS CENTER Maine.

I think we all know why #SusanCollins is the most unpopular Senator in the country. It‚Äôs because she stopped listening to us. As Democrats, we can't criticize her and then do the same thing. That‚Äôs why today, I‚Äôve called on my fellow Democratic candidates for U.S. Senate to participate in a series of 16 debates before the June 9 primary -- one in each one of Maine‚Äôs counties.  Voters deserve to hear our ideas for getting Maine and the country back on track, and they deserve to hear those ideas directly from us. If you agree with me, please share this message. https://www.centralmaine.com/2020/03/03/lajeunesse-calls-for-debates-among-collins-democratic-challengers/

U.S. Senate candidate Ross LaJeunesse is calling for a series of 16 public debates between Maine‚Äôs Democratic candidates seeking to challenge Republican U.S. Sen. Susan Collins in November. ‚ÄúMaine voters have a right to hear from the candidates,‚Äù said LaJeunesse, a former executive at Google. ‚ÄúAny candidate asking for a Maine voter‚Äôs vote should get in front of voters and explain why they‚Äôre running and what ideas they have for getting Maine and the country back on track.‚Äù
I'll be here all day! #RossForMaine

We can‚Äôt beat Susan Collins with another career politician. And we won't get the change we need with another career politician. I‚Äôve never run for office before, but I have the experience to get things done. Maine needs an independent voice to deliver affordable healthcare, take action on the climate crisis, and tackle income inequality. When elected to the U.S. Senate, I'll take on the the D.C. establishment and make sure our government and our economy work for ALL of us. Join me. #RossForMaine

I knew I was a little different from the other kids growing up because #ElectionDay made me as excited as Christmas! Voted in my hometown of Biddeford this morning and said thank you to my mom as she helped collect signatures to get me on the June 9th ballot for US Senate. Love you Mom!

When I came out in 1990, you couldn't work at the State Department as an openly LGBTQ person, or serve in the military. So I never dreamed I'd see an openly gay presidential candidate. I'm so proud of Pete Buttigieg and what he accomplished -- for the Democratic party, for LGBTQ people everywhere, and for our country.  Representation matters. I'd be honored to be the first openly gay man elected to the U.S. Senate.

Another great day on the campaign trail with the Franklin County Democrats - Maine in Farmington. Thank you for your thoughtful questions! And petition signatures! :) I look forward to seeing everyone again soon. Now, back to Biddeford! #RossForMaine

Some highlights from a great (and chilly!) day up north... Thank you to the Aroostook County Democrats for hosting me today, and to everyone in Fort Kent for offering such a warm welcome on a cold day.  I have to give a special shout-out to Darlene from Allagash -- I'm so happy we were able to meet! I'm looking forward to meeting with the Franklin County Democrats - Maine tomorrow -- details on my events calendar.

Heading up to Fort Kent this evening! I'll be at the Can-Am sled dog race tomorrow morning, and will visit with the Aroostook County Democrats . On Sunday, I'll speak with Franklin County Democrats - Maine in Farmington. Check out my events calendar for details!

I want to wish a Happy 60th Birthday to the wonderful Yvonne Noury! Yvonne is a key reason Patrick and I go to All Day Breakfast in Biddeford. She always has a smile on her face and pep in her step! Thank you Yvonne for supporting our campaign for #OneMaine. Have a great day!

Hey everyone -- I just added a few events to my events calendar. Tomorrow evening, I'll be speaking with the Androscoggin County Democrats in Auburn. I'm heading up north on Friday and will meet with the Aroostook County Democrats Saturday morning in Fort Kent. On Sunday, I'll speak with Franklin County Democrats - Maine in Farmington.  Check out my events calendar for details and let me know in the comments if I can plan on seeing you. Be sure to bring questions!

"LaJeunesse‚Äôs agenda also includes priorities such as increasing access to high-speed internet for rural Americans and protecting workers from automation, an issue he says 'too few people in Washington seem to know or care about.' "Simultaneously, the plan seeks to ensure that American children are provided with the tools necessary to 'fully participate in the economy of the future' by calling on the Education Department to work with technology companies to develop computer science and other curricula. Speaking to The New Yorker, LaJeunesse said he believes technology can be an 'equalizer' for children. ‚Äú'Wealthy families always had access to more resources,' he said. 'But, if you were, like, a poor kid in Maine, in rural Maine, you‚Äôre kind of stuck, and tech changed that.'"

ICYMI: I released my Tech Reform Agenda on Thursday.  80,000 Maine households lack access to high-speed internet -- those families are being left behind, and that's just not right. Read my plan to get Maine connected to high-speed internet and ensure all Americans benefit from tech -- not just tech company execs and shareholders:  https://medium.com/@rossformaine/my-tech-reform-agenda-d36119afa29a

Took advantage of the warm weather today and went door-to-door gathering signatures in Biddeford. Meeting voters and talking with them about the issues is the only ethical way to run, and it's the only way to win! Visit rossformaine.com/get-involved to get involved with our campaign -- I can't win this race without you! #RossForMaine

The Russians are doing it AGAIN. Trump's reaction?  Fire the guy who told Congress the truth and replace him with a sycophant unqualified to do the job. Susan Collins -- where is your outrage? What are you doing to protect our democracy and our national security?   We have a choice this November.  Elect leaders who will actually do something to protect our democracy.  Or, follow the Susan Collins model of expressing our "disappointment" while doing nothing.  Check out Part 5 of my Tech Reform Agenda to learn more about my plan to protect our elections: https://7c9bc961-a012-414e-a13e-a3a684a5c0eb.filesusr.com/ugd/b1cc02_d936bc66c80f4211a235f83b48a2d6fd.pdf

Wow. We had an incredible office opening in Biddeford. Thank you to my husband Patrick, my parents, my Aunt Charlene, and all the family, friends and supporters who showed up to join our team on a cold winter night.  PS: My team surprised me with the ‚ÄúRoss‚Äù sign you see in the background -- thanks guys -- no wonder politicians can get a little full of themselves! üòÜ I look forward to seeing everyone again soon.

"We don't have people in Congress who even understand the basics around tech, let alone how to make sure everyone benefits," LaJeunesse said in an interview. "It's crazy." Thanks to Axios reporter Ina Fried for chatting with me about my tech reform agenda.

More than 80,000 Maine households still lack high-speed internet access. Those are students and families who are being left out of the 21st century economy ‚Äî that‚Äôs not right and it‚Äôs not acceptable. Congress has not only neglected its oversight of tech companies, it has neglected its responsibility to ensure that the benefits of technology and the digital economy reach all Americans. Here's my 10-point plan for technology reform:  https://medium.com/@rossformaine/my-tech-reform-agenda-d36119afa29a
Without regulation of big tech, telling fact from fiction will become impossible.  Learn about my Tech Reform Agenda here: https://medium.com/@rossformaine/my-tech-reform-agenda-d36119afa29a
Who is joining us tomorrow in Biddeford? If you can't make it in person, be sure to tune into the livestream on this page!

Susan Collins has forgotten who sent her to the Senate 24 years ago. Remember when she promised she would only serve two terms?  We must nominate a candidate who can defeat Susan in November. I believe my bipartisan experience in government -- with mentors like Senators George Mitchell, Ted Kennedy and Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger -- my experience in business and international relations, and my record of standing up to the powerful make me the best candidate to take on Susan and win. I know that political insiders have already anointed their favored candidate -- but Mainers have never taken their lead from DC. Want to hear more about my plans for #OneMaine? Stop by my office opening in Biddeford Thursday, or tune into this page for the livestream. https://www.thecut.com/2020/02/susan-collins-moderate-legacy-trump.html

Joined my mom at Planet Fitness in Biddeford today. She's 75 and she works out four times a week! She‚Äôs my hero, and not because of her workout schedule.  I often tell the story about how we almost lost our home when I was a teenager -- my mom went to work cleaning houses in Kennebunkport so we could keep our own. She‚Äôs my hero because she has always sacrificed, worked hard, and put her family first -- like so many working women do.

Hi everyone -- I'm sorry to share that we've had to cancel tomorrow's town hall event with Indivisible Northwest Kennebec due to weather. We're working to reschedule -- stay tuned to this page for updates.

A few scenes from the weekend. I enjoyed chatting with the Democrats of The Kennebunks and Arundel Saturday -- thank you for having me. Patrick and I stopped by Tandem Coffee this morning. When Mainers are willing to wait in line outside in the winter, you know it's a great place! I‚Äôm looking forward to seeing many of you at our office opening Thursday!
Help me welcome the newest addition to our family, Annabel Gisela Godbout!  Annabel was born a few weeks ago to my cousin Jonathan and his amazing wife Vero in Waterville.
Thank you Gaby and Brian for hosting a #RossForMaine meet and greet in your beautiful home. It was great to meet so many first-time voters!

Happy Valentine's Day to everyone.   I spent so many years focused on my work, I remember thinking that I'd never have a special someone -- that it was part of the sacrifice of a demanding career. I feel so lucky to have met my person, my husband Patrick.  He keeps me on my toes, and at the same time, keeps my feet firmly on the ground. Love you forever, Patrick. cc: LGBTQ Victory Fund
What's better than a Valentine from your hubby? One from your 7-year-old niece! ü•∞

I've pledged to host public events across the state as a candidate, and as your Senator.  I'm committed to meeting every Mainer who wants to meet me.  I believe that before any candidate asks for your vote, they have to show up for you. That's my commitment to you. I hope to see you soon! cc: Town Hall Project Mainers for Accountable Leadership
Thanks to the Knox Maine Democrats for hosting me this evening! Check out my events page for more opportunities to meet with me and learn about our campaign for #OneMaine.

A budget is a statement of values. After creating a trillion dollar federal deficit by giving tax cuts to corporations and the wealthiest among us, the Trump Administration now wants to cut resources from programs Mainers need like Medicaid, the Children‚Äôs Health Insurance Program and Medicare. They‚Äôve even proposed to slash the budget of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) -- while the coronavirus continues to spread.  The Trump Administration‚Äôs priorities -- along with allies in Congress like Susan Collins -- are clear: they want their campaign donors to get wealthier, at our expense. It's corruption, plain and simple. As Maine‚Äôs Senator, I will fight to lower healthcare costs -- not corporate tax rates. I‚Äôll work to get high-speed internet to every Mainer, and to ensure all of our kids -- regardless of where they grow up -- have the opportunities they need to succeed in the 21st century. Those are Maine values, and part of my vision for #OneMaine

As the former head of International Relations for Google, I think it‚Äôs important for Americans to understand how much power tech companies wield in our democracy, and across the world. We cannot let these companies self-regulate any longer.  As I shared in this interview, I worked for and learned from George Mitchell and Ted Kennedy -- that's the kind of Senator that I would be.  It's clear what Google wants: they've donated the maximum to Susan Collins' re-election campaign. They know she won't regulate them. I will.

I had a great afternoon with the Waldo County Democratic Committee. Thanks to everyone for your enthusiasm for this race: having so many people ask thoughtful questions, sign our petitions, and get signed up to volunteer with the campaign was thrilling. Check out my events page for more opportunities to meet me this week and next!
I'm using this Saturday to get ready for a busy week -- I look forward to seeing many of you along the way. Check out my events page for full details. Enjoy the weekend!

Hey everyone -- I have a number of events coming up this week and next. I hope to meet many of you along the way! I'm committed to meeting every Mainer who wants to meet me. Details are on my events calendar.
I'll be in Belfast tomorrow afternoon with the Waldo County Democratic Committee -- join me if you can.

I'm excited to share that we're opening our #RossForMaine campaign headquarters in my hometown, Biddeford. Click the link to RSVP -- I'm looking forward to meeting everyone! https://secure.ngpvan.com/FnDtjsPLqEOwcjDt2Enn7Q2
Mainers, we must elect a new Senator.  Susan Collins is afraid to speak truth to power, I‚Äôm not.  https://twitter.com/GreggWGME/status/1225146095690489857
Here's my statement on Susan Collins' decision to vote for Donald Trump's acquittal. Join me: https://www.rossformaine.com/

I'm not a career politician, I don't take corporate PAC money, and I certainly haven't had any campaign ethics complaints filed against me. It's time for new leadership for Maine. #RossForMaine #MESen

Google has donated $10,000 to Susan Collins' reelection campaign. This is how the system works: corporations write big checks, and politicians listen.  This is corruption, plain and simple, and it has infected our democracy. Unlike Susan Collins, I don't take corporate PAC money. My silence can't be bought. Join me: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/rossformaine?refcode=ws

The use of "deepfakes" in political ads is an important issue requiring smart regulation. Tech companies have shown they're willing to allow propaganda on their platforms, putting profits ahead of principles. We can no longer allow these companies to self-regulate.  https://www.pressherald.com/2020/01/29/maine-lawmakers-take-up-bill-to-ban-deepfake-political-ads/

Susan Collins only crosses the aisle when it won‚Äôt hurt Mitch McConnell‚Äôs agenda. That‚Äôs not the independent voice Mainers elected 24 years ago. It‚Äôs not the voice we need in the Senate now. Join my campaign for #OneMaine:  https://secure.actblue.com/donate/rossformaine?refcode=ws
I‚Äôm committed to meeting every Mainer who wants to meet me during this campaign. That‚Äôs what voters deserve. Join me and the Waldo County Democrats in Belfast Feb. 9!

The Trump Administration, with help from Susan Collins, gave away a $1.5 trillion tax cut to the wealthiest Americans. Now that they've created a trillion dollar deficit, Republicans propose to cut Medicaid benefits for the seniors who need it most. Our health care is on the ballot in 2020. https://www.vox.com/policy-and-politics/2020/1/30/21113436/trump-health-care-policy-medicaid-cuts

ICYMI: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm not in this race to make a point. I‚Äôm in the race to win it. I‚Äôm in the race because I think I‚Äôm the best candidate to beat Sen. Collins.‚Äù  Thanks to reporter David Sharp for chatting with me about my campaign.  https://www.pressherald.com/2020/01/23/democrat-looking-to-unseat-sen-collins-wins-key-endorsement/

This is great news for Portland and for Maine. It's exciting to think about the opportunities the Roux Institute will bring for Maine students and communities -- the jobs of the future are in science and technology.  We must ensure that the benefits of technology are shared by all.  I look forward to sharing my tech reform agenda with you soon -- stay tuned to this page!

Traumatic brain injuries can affect our veterans and service members for the rest of their lives -- these are not merely ‚Äúheadaches.‚Äù  This is personal for me. My father was wounded in combat in Vietnam, and is still struggling to get the care he earned. Shame on President Trump, and shame on Susan Collins for not speaking out.

‚ÄúSen. Collins‚Äô first loyalties seem to be to herself, her party and her political career rather than to truth, democracy, this nation and the rule of law."  Thank you, Jennifer for speaking out. I couldn‚Äôt agree more -- it‚Äôs profoundly disappointing to see Senator Collins fail us time and again. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm running against her. https://www.pressherald.com/2020/01/24/letter-to-the-editor-collins-failing-to-seize-leadership-opportunity/

Thanks to the Ogunquit Democratic Town Committee for meeting with me last night! I am committed to listening to every Mainer who wants to meet me -- stay tuned to this page for event info. #RossForMaine #MESen

source: Ross LaJeunesse for Maine,LGBTQ Victory Fund
text: Thank you LGBTQ Victory Fund. I'd be honored to be the first openly gay man to serve in the U.S. Senate. Mainers deserve a Senator who is willing to stand up for equality and justice; a Senator who is unafraid to speak truth to power.  Join me: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/ross_email?refcode=victoryfundThis year, we have the opportunity to stand up to Susan Collins and elect Maine‚Äôs first openly LGBTQ US Senator, Ross LaJeunesse for Maine. Victory Fund is proud to stand with Ross and support his history-making run. If elected Ross will join openly LGBTQ Senators Tammy Baldwin and Kyrsten Sinema and fight for LGBTQ equality in the world's greatest deliberative body.

Thanks to the Biddeford Saco Rotary Club for hosting me last week. We had a great conversation about how Mainers deserve a Senator who will show up for them -- a Senator who is experienced, accessible and honest.  I will be that sort of Senator when I'm elected. If you're near Ogunquit, I'd love to meet you on Thursday -- I'll be visiting with the Ogunquit Democratic Town Committee 6 p.m. 1/23. (details in the comments)

As we remember the leadership and sacrifice of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. today, it's important to recognize that Dr. King's dream is still a work in progress. Its 2020 and voting rights are under attack, hate crimes are on the rise and many of our leaders in Washington seem most interested in helping the wealthy get wealthier. It's also an election year. And I have a feeling that Americans will show up to the polls with the same passion that brought a quarter of a million Americans to the 1963 March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom. I hope everyone uses a moment today to reflect on the enormous task ahead, and the profound opportunity we have to make change.
Join me Thursday evening in Ogunquit!
Check out my full interview with Kasie Hunt on MSNBC:

Each of our U.S. Senators will take an oath today to deliver "impartial justice" in the impeachment trial of Donald Trump. Even so, what‚Äôs happening in the Senate won't be a trial. You don‚Äôt have to be a lawyer to know that in a democracy, a trial means evidence, witnesses, and an impartial judge and jury. When Mitch McConnell announced he‚Äôs coordinating with the White House counsel, it was as outrageous as a jury foreman announcing he's working to help the defense attorney. Susan Collins has spent more than twenty years in Washington. It's become clear that she's more interested in appeasing Mitch McConnell and President Trump than seeking the truth about this president's abuses of power. That's wrong, and that's why I'm running against her.  We deserve a Senator who will follow the facts impartially and put our democracy ahead of loyalty to a political party. I've stood up to powerful people before. That's exactly what I'll do when I'm elected to the U.S. Senate.

Mainers deserve a Senator who is willing to follow the facts, get to the bottom of President Trump‚Äôs abuses of power, and put our democracy before loyalty to a political party. That's why I'm running against Susan Collins.  Join me: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/rossformaine?refcode=ws

The people and the institutions who say they‚Äôre looking out for us, who say they care about us, who say they have our backs, are lying to us. I look at Susan Collins, for example. One of the few things she‚Äôs done in the past two years, despite Maine suffering economically, was vote for a $1.5 trillion tax cut for large corporations like Google -- that don't need the money. That‚Äôs corruption plain and simple, and Maine deserves better. Thanks HILL TV for the interview.

I want voters to know the story of why I left Google because it‚Äôs a reflection of my values.  When this happened, I could have done what many company executives have chosen to do ‚Äî put my head down and shut up. But instead, I stood up ‚Äî and I spoke up. That's the way I was raised and that's the way I live my life. Thanks QuickTake by Bloomberg for the interview. #RossForMaine
I'll be live with Kasie Hunt on MSNBC in a few minutes -- tune in!
Here's my full interview with CBSN this morning: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e6HF6fAEk8s&feature=youtu.be #RossOnTour #RossForMaine
I had the opportunity to chat to CBSN this morning about my Senate campaign -- stay tuned for the story! #RossOnTour #RossForMaine
Thank you to the York County Democratic Committee for hosting me last night. It was so exciting to be in a packed room of Mainers committed to fighting for change in 2020! #RossOnTour #RossForMaine
Catch me on NEWS CENTER Maine tonight in the 11 p.m. hour if you're up late! Thanks to reporter Sean Stackhouse for the interview. #RossForMaine #RossOnTour

Here are a few scenes from this week's trip across Maine -- I started in my hometown of Biddeford and made my way to Bangor and Brewer, then Bucksport and Belfast, and ended the day in Bar Harbor (and no, I did not set out to visit just B‚Äôs). Thank you to everyone who has shared their stories with me along the way.  Tonight I‚Äôll be at the @YorkCountyDemocraticCommittee meeting at Alfred Parish Church, 6 p.m. Please stop by and say hello! #RossOnTour

It's official: I picked up petitions in Augusta to get on the June 9 Democratic primary ballot. This is about creating #OneMaine, where all our families can thrive. Let's go! #RossForMaine #RossOnTour
On the road again this week, listening to Mainers all across the state and sharing my vision of One Maine. Follow along at #RossonTour!
Join us Wednesday in Bar Harbor! #RossOnTour

Here's my Closing Bell Interview.  When all this happened at Google, I could have done what many company executives have chosen to do ‚Äî put my head down and shut up. But instead, I stood up ‚Äî and I spoke up. That's the way I was raised and that's the way I live. Are you with me? https://secure.actblue.com/donate/ross_wapo_email?refcode=104_wapo2_button&amount=20&recurring=1 #RossForMaine

President Trump‚Äôs decision to launch a unilateral airstrike in Iraq  -- without Congressional authorization -- represents a reckless escalation towards another war in the Middle East, and yet another broken promise from a president who pledged to end "endless wars." Mainers will shed no tears today for General Soleimani or for the murderous Iranian regime in Tehran. Still, our state knows far too well the cost of endless war. Since 2003, we have lost too many brave men and women in the Middle East. My father, a proud veteran, still bears the scars of the Vietnam War. We must never allow decisions of war to be made unilaterally or recklessly. Senator Collins has been a bystander on these issues for far too long, enabling the Trump administration‚Äôs erratic and dangerous foreign policy. In the Senate, I'll stand up for the rule of law. We must not allow the men and women of our armed forces to be dragged into another endless war.
I'll be live on Closing Bell at 4:45 p.m. ET -- tune in if you can! #RossforMaine
‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be evil.‚Äù I joined Google in 2008, when those words still mattered. Here‚Äôs my story, in my own words.

This story is bigger than me, and it's bigger than Google. Greed and abuse of power have not only infected American companies like Google, they've infected Washington too. And it's time to stop it. Susan Collins voted for a $1.5 trillion tax break for companies like Google while working parents in my community literally can‚Äôt afford to get sick. Her priorities are clear, and so are mine. I'm in this to fight to help get my state and our country back on track. #RossForMaine https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/01/02/top-google-exec-pushed-company-commit-human-rights-then-google-pushed-him-out-he-says/
Happy New Year's Eve! In 2020, we have the opportunity to get our country and our state back on track. Are you with me? #RossForMaine
It's cold out there! More snow is on the way -- please stay safe, keep warm and look out for your neighbors ‚ùÑÔ∏è #RossforMaine

Many of our communities don't have high speed internet access.  This is holding back our economy and our students. One of the key pieces of my plan for #OneMaine is investment in the infrastructure Mainers need to thrive in the 21st Century economy. Thanks Portland Press Herald for raising the issue!

My campaign for U.S. Senate is about creating #OneMaine -- ensuring all Mainers have access to affordable healthcare and making sure our state has the resources needed to combat the opioid epidemic. It‚Äôs all about priorities, and it starts with rolling back Susan Collins‚Äô $1.5 trillion corporate tax cut. Thank you to the great Mal Leary and Maine Public for the interview.
Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays, from my family to yours.
Chag sameach to all the families celebrating Hanukah this evening. Enjoy the holiday!

Today, I wrote to each of Maine‚Äôs U.S. Senators highlighting the importance of a fair and impartial impeachment trial for President Trump.  This is not a time for partisan politics.  All Senators must act according to the facts, and in line with their Constitutional duties.  Open letter to Susan Collins: https://medium.com/@rossformaine/open-letter-to-susan-collins-91bb93eef5c Open letter to Angus King: https://medium.com/@rossformaine/open-letter-to-angus-king-548f19ef5466

I began this campaign by speaking about the #TwoMaines. According to a recent study from the federal Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) -- written up in today‚Äôs Portland Press Herald -- Cumberland and York counties alone account for nearly half of our state‚Äôs economic activity.  Another recent BEA study ranked Maine as 49 out of the 50 states in terms of economic growth.  My campaign is about coming together to create One Maine: repairing our aging infrastructure, connecting Mainers to high-speed internet, high-quality, affordable health care, and encouraging business development in the Maine communities that have struggled for decades. Are you with me? Check out the study in today‚Äôs Portland Press Herald here: https://www.pressherald.com/2019/12/16/cumberland-county-dominates-maines-economy/ and help our campaign share our message of One Maine by sharing our campaign launch video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AQGffLSA51k&t #RossForMaine #MESen

Mitch McConnell has announced that he plans on fully coordinating with the White House on how the President‚Äôs impeachment trial is run in the Senate.  Let me be clear: that‚Äôs not a real trial -- that's like the jury foreman saying he's going to coordinate with the defense team. McConnell‚Äôs actions are a disgrace to our Constitution.  And we know that where Mitch McConnell leads, Susan Collins is sure to follow.  We need principled leaders who will always put country over party, and we sadly can‚Äôt count on Susan Collins. That's exactly why I'm running to represent my fellow Mainers in the U.S. Senate, but I can't do it without your help.  https://secure.actblue.com/donate/rossformaine?refcode=ws
I'm beyond thankful to spend my birthday with my incredible husband, Patrick. Thank you to everyone who has sent me birthday wishes today -- it means the world.

Thank you to Governor Janet Mills for leading the creation of an economic development plan for Maine. This plan is the first of its kind in more than two decades, and sadly, we can see the impact of that all around us.  Maine was recently ranked the 49th state in terms of economic growth. That means fewer good paying jobs for working Maine families. Governor Mills' plan includes revitalizing our aging infrastructure, rural broadband initiatives, and efforts to increase our workforce. These are critical issues:  it's very hard to start a new business, work remotely, or educate our kids for the economy of the future without reliable high-speed internet! I applaud Governor Mills for her leadership, and look forward to partnering with her in the U.S. Senate to provide federal support for this plan. Check out the plan here: https://bangordailynews.com/2019/12/11/politics/read-janet-mills-10-year-economic-plan-for-maine/

Today is not a day for celebration, but it does show the strength of our Democracy. A bedrock principle of America is that no one is above the law. If and when this impeachment process moves to the Senate, the Senate must fulfill its Constitutional obligations by providing a speedy, transparent and fair trial.This is one of the most brutal take downs of the DNC you will ever see.

Thank you to Holly Ayoob (who roasts incredible coffee in Biddeford!) for sharing her story in this morning's Portland Press Herald. I encourage you to read and share. We deserve a Senator who will protect our health care, not jeopardize it. https://www.pressherald.com/2019/12/07/letter-to-the-editor-collins-decisions-have-helped-put-aca-at-risk/

Susan Collins voted to ensure the wealthiest corporations got a $1.5 trillion tax cut. Meanwhile, the Trump Administration is taking food away from Mainers who need it, just in time for the holidays. The stakes could not be higher in this race: we need to elect a Senator with the right priorities. https://www.pressherald.com/2019/12/05/our-view-work-requirement-no-way-to-fight-hunger-in-maine/

Here's a flash from the past: my mother Pearl, juggling her three kids. I'm the one in gray üôÇ Not only did my mom take care of my siblings and me, she also babysat neighborhood kids and cleaned homes in Kennebunkport to make ends meet for our family. Too many families in Maine are working hard and doing their best, just like my mother did -- and still, they‚Äôre struggling to get by. I know what that feels like, because that's how I grew up. At one point, we almost lost our home. Things aren't any easier for working families today -- they‚Äôve gotten worse. We need a U.S. Senator who has a vision of ONE MAINE and who will fight for all Mainers. Check out my Issues page to learn more.  https://www.rossformaine.com/issues/

My Mom, Dad, Aunt Charlene and I spent the afternoon serving meals to the hungry at the Most Holy Trinity Church in Saco, alongside the Knights of Columbus, leaders from the Biddeford Food Pantry, and dozens of other volunteers.  Today and every day, I‚Äôm thankful for my family and our incredible community.  Happy Thanksgiving!

Hi everyone -- we‚Äôre delighted that many of you have reached out and asked how you can support our campaign. Here are 4Ô∏è‚É£ easy ways to help us spread the word:  1Ô∏è‚É£ Stay in touch! Sign up for campaign updates and volunteer opportunities here: https://www.rossformaine.com/get-involved/  2Ô∏è‚É£ Share our launch video on your social media accounts and let your friends know about the campaign: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AQGffLSA51k  3Ô∏è‚É£ Make sure to follow the campaign across social media -- @RossforMaine  4Ô∏è‚É£ Help us spread our message by making a contribution today: https://secure.actblue.com/donate/rossformaine?refcode=ws  Thank you!

After I launched my campaign, I hit the road to talk with working Mainers all across our state. I'll continue sharing the stories of the people I meet, because far too many Mainers are working hard, doing their best, and playing by the rules -- and still, they're struggling to get by. That's why I'm running for the U.S. Senate: because Mainers deserve better. I met Barbara while visiting a pharmacy in Orono. She‚Äôs trained as a Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) but can't afford to maintain her CMA certification. Barbara is trying to find a job that will pay enough to support herself and her daughter, but so far hasn't been able to find one.  Barbara is a single mother who receives food stamps and MaineCare. She wants to work, but knows that if she takes even a low-paying job, she and her daughter will likely be kicked off MaineCare. Barbara confided that she feels guilty about using public assistance programs, but believes it‚Äôs the best option she has for her daughter. We need all the healthcare workers we can get in Maine -- we‚Äôre the oldest state in the nation -- and have to be sure that our workers are not only paid a living wage, but also have access to the type of healthcare that they're providing to others.  If I'm elected to the U.S. Senate, I'll fight like hell to ensure that Maine receives the federal assistance needed to provide high quality, affordable healthcare to all Mainers. #RossonTour #RossForMaine #MESen

I had a great time at the Democratic Senate candidates forum yesterday in Rockport. Thank you to the Maine Teen Advocacy Coalition and the Knox County Democrats for hosting. I was so impressed with the students‚Äô thoughtful questions ‚Äî these young people deserve a US Senator who will fight for them every day in Washington.
I‚Äôm looking forward to taking questions from the Maine Teen Advocacy Coalition tomorrow afternoon in Rockport. This event is open to the public ‚Äî join us in person or on the livestream!

Last week, I hit the road to talk with working Mainers all across our state. For the next few days I'll share the stories of a few of the Mainers I met along the way. I met Brooke in Lewiston, where she works as a barista.  Brooke‚Äôs father suffered from severe nerve pain, and was prescribed opiate pain killers to help him manage his pain.  A year into his treatment, Brooke‚Äôs father admitted to her that he was addicted -- that he needed the pills to get by.  Brooke‚Äôs father struggled with his addiction for about five years, before he passed away in August.  Brooke -- just 22 -- told me that she hadn‚Äôt been able to attend college because she had to work and take care of her father for the last three years of his life.  At the end of our talk, Brooke said something to me that I‚Äôll remember for a very long time: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm trying to do everything right, but it‚Äôs just not working for me.‚Äù Brooke shared her phone number with me and when I called her to hear more about her story, the call dropped not once -- but five times. Our difficulty in having a simple phone call was another sign of how Maine‚Äôs leaders need to do more.  In far too many parts of the state, there is unreliable mobile phone coverage, let alone high speed internet availability.  This is the basic infrastructure that every Mainer deserves, and which is necessary for Maine to grow its economy. Brooke has done all the right things, but our leaders aren‚Äôt doing right by her -- just as we didn‚Äôt provide her father with the help they needed to beat his addiction.  As painful as it is, Brooke‚Äôs story is far too common throughout Maine.   Health care resources for folks struggling with addiction, support for young students who don‚Äôt have the financial means to attend college, and widely-available high speed internet aren‚Äôt just policy issues: these are the resources that will change the lives of young people like Brooke. We cannot leave her behind. #RossforMaine #RossonTour

This is personal for me, as I have transgender family and friends.  Please take time today to reflect on the lives we've lost this year, and then GET INVOLVED in the fight for full equality for transgender and gender non-conforming individuals. #TDOR #TDoR2019

Together, we can fight back against the dysfunction in Washington. That's why I'm running to unseat Susan Collins‚Äîto fight for the Maine, and the country, that we all know we deserve. If you missed my launch event you can read my speech below. #mesen #RossforMaine

Heading home. What an amazing trip! I feel honored to have had the chance to speak with so many incredible Mainers and hear their stories.  Thank you all for following me on this tour, I can't wait to continue this campaign with you. #RossonTour #mepolitics #mesen
I had a great time visiting Orono! Heard some more powerful stories from Mainers.  Heading over to Millinocket today! #RossonTour #mepolitics #mesen

Amazing day talking with voters, business owners, and community leaders in Bangor! Excited to head up to Orono and Old Town tomorrow‚Äîit will be another great day talking with Mainers. #RossonTour #mepolitics #mesen

The cold won't stop us from talking with voters across the state.  Heard some powerful stories about the struggles many Mainers know far too well. It doesn't have to be this way! That's why I'm running, to be the senator who fights for you everyday. #RossonTour #mepolitics

Amazing first day on the road chatting with Mainers. Started at Palace Diner in Biddeford, traveled to Brunswick, and finished the day off in Lewiston! Can‚Äôt wait to do it all again tomorrow. Off to Bangor in the morning! #RossOnTour #mepolitics Chip in and support Ross on Tour! https://bit.ly/2O6e0ar

Today, I‚Äôm launching my first trip across Maine! I‚Äôll be meeting Mainers all over the state, listening to their questions and concerns, and sharing my vision for One Maine. Here are some of the places we‚Äôre going this week. I hope to see you on the road! #RossOnTour

This young marine is my dad, Norman.  He was wounded serving in Vietnam. We owe him, and every veteran, the utmost respect, gratitude and care that they have earned for their service.  Thats why I support expanding federal funding for VA programs. Thank you dad, I love you. Learn more about my plan to improve care for veterans: https://www.rossformaine.com/issues/

Today, while at the St. Joseph's Church Christmas Fair in Biddeford, I got to meet the first female deputy sheriff in York County, 92-year-old Marie LaBrecque! She shared some amazing stories with me. It was incredible to speak with a trailblazer like her, and I'm honored to have her support!

I know Mainers, I know their struggles, and I'm not going to forget about them when I'm their senator.  If you weren't able to attend my campaign kickoff event, read the article about it from WGME CBS 13 News, Portland below.  #mepol #mesen

source: Ross LaJeunesse for Maine,Ross LaJeunesse for Maine
text: My campaign kickoff event is starting soon! Watch the livestream here!

Thank you to Maine Public for doing an interview with me and recording this great podcast on my entrance to the Senate race. Check it out! I cannot wait to see you all tomorrow at my campaign kick off rally, 2PM at Mechanics Park in Biddeford! #MEPol

Launch day is off to a rocking start! I'll be on Maine Public at 1:06 pm discussing my campaign for the U.S. Senate and how we're gonna send Susan Collins packing! You can tune in here: https://mainepublic.org

Susan Collins claims to be an independent voice in the Senate. But after two decades in Washington, she's proven that her loyalty to Maine stops at the door to Mitch McConnell's office. I'm running for Senate to fight for working Mainers. I hope you'll join me. https://RossforMaine.com
Happy New Year's Eve! In 2020, we have the opportunity to get our country and our state back on track. Are you with me? #RossForMaine
It's cold out there! More snow is on the way -- please stay safe, keep warm and look out for your neighbors ‚ùÑÔ∏è #RossforMaine

Many of our communities don't have high speed internet access.  This is holding back our economy and our students. One of the key pieces of my plan for #OneMaine is investment in the infrastructure Mainers need to thrive in the 21st Century economy. Thanks Portland Press Herald for raising the issue!

My campaign for U.S. Senate is about creating #OneMaine -- ensuring all Mainers have access to affordable healthcare and making sure our state has the resources needed to combat the opioid epidemic. It‚Äôs all about priorities, and it starts with rolling back Susan Collins‚Äô $1.5 trillion corporate tax cut. Thank you to the great Mal Leary and Maine Public for the interview.
Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays, from my family to yours.
Chag sameach to all the families celebrating Hanukah this evening. Enjoy the holiday!

Today, I wrote to each of Maine‚Äôs U.S. Senators highlighting the importance of a fair and impartial impeachment trial for President Trump.  This is not a time for partisan politics.  All Senators must act according to the facts, and in line with their Constitutional duties.  Open letter to Susan Collins: https://medium.com/@rossformaine/open-letter-to-susan-collins-91bb93eef5c Open letter to Angus King: https://medium.com/@rossformaine/open-letter-to-angus-king-548f19ef5466

I began this campaign by speaking about the #TwoMaines. According to a recent study from the federal Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) -- written up in today‚Äôs Portland Press Herald -- Cumberland and York counties alone account for nearly half of our state‚Äôs economic activity.  Another recent BEA study ranked Maine as 49 out of the 50 states in terms of economic growth.  My campaign is about coming together to create One Maine: repairing our aging infrastructure, connecting Mainers to high-speed internet, high-quality, affordable health care, and encouraging business development in the Maine communities that have struggled for decades. Are you with me? Check out the study in today‚Äôs Portland Press Herald here: https://www.pressherald.com/2019/12/16/cumberland-county-dominates-maines-economy/ and help our campaign share our message of One Maine by sharing our campaign launch video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AQGffLSA51k&t #RossForMaine #MESen

Mitch McConnell has announced that he plans on fully coordinating with the White House on how the President‚Äôs impeachment trial is run in the Senate.  Let me be clear: that‚Äôs not a real trial -- that's like the jury foreman saying he's going to coordinate with the defense team. McConnell‚Äôs actions are a disgrace to our Constitution.  And we know that where Mitch McConnell leads, Susan Collins is sure to follow.  We need principled leaders who will always put country over party, and we sadly can‚Äôt count on Susan Collins. That's exactly why I'm running to represent my fellow Mainers in the U.S. Senate, but I can't do it without your help.  https://secure.actblue.com/donate/rossformaine?refcode=ws
I'm beyond thankful to spend my birthday with my incredible husband, Patrick. Thank you to everyone who has sent me birthday wishes today -- it means the world.

Thank you to Governor Janet Mills for leading the creation of an economic development plan for Maine. This plan is the first of its kind in more than two decades, and sadly, we can see the impact of that all around us.  Maine was recently ranked the 49th state in terms of economic growth. That means fewer good paying jobs for working Maine families. Governor Mills' plan includes revitalizing our aging infrastructure, rural broadband initiatives, and efforts to increase our workforce. These are critical issues:  it's very hard to start a new business, work remotely, or educate our kids for the economy of the future without reliable high-speed internet! I applaud Governor Mills for her leadership, and look forward to partnering with her in the U.S. Senate to provide federal support for this plan. Check out the plan here: https://bangordailynews.com/2019/12/11/politics/read-janet-mills-10-year-economic-plan-for-maine/

Today is not a day for celebration, but it does show the strength of our Democracy. A bedrock principle of America is that no one is above the law. If and when this impeachment process moves to the Senate, the Senate must fulfill its Constitutional obligations by providing a speedy, transparent and fair trial.This is one of the most brutal take downs of the DNC you will ever see.
